ygData.subject: RE: utter fustration (but with a humorous ending) - OT
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I m a special case.  My wife started her first character, a warrior, when I started my bard and my brother-in-law started his third character, a Paladin,
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Lonnie Lewis <LLewis@...>
>
> > From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
> >
> > I have probably solo'ed a full half a bubble (I hate solo'ing) of all my
> > XP
> > gained to level 30.
> >
> Even levels 1-5? I didn't start grouping at level 4, I think, and
> for the most part have grouped constantly throughout (though I do try
> soloing every now and then, it's not a significant amount of my total xp)
>
> <snip>
>

I'm a special case. My wife started her first character, a warrior, when I
started my bard and my brother-in-law started his third character, a
Paladin, all at the same time. I did levels 1 through 5 grouped with them.
My first character is a retired level 21 mage that I haven't logged on with
in months and consider retired.

> > A side note: I usually always ask that any bard (including myself) only
> > weave 2 MR songs when doing MR. Missing a note and dropping
> one of the MR
> > songs can be to devistating to risk that possibility.
> >
> My usualy strategy for this, is to make those 2 the most important.
> In other words, I'll try and do 3 songs, but if I miss a note on anthem,
> I'll skip it and restart 1st MR song, then 2nd MR song, then try Anthem
> again. Or if I miss a note of 2nd MR song, restart 2nd MR song,
> go back to
> 1st MR song and repeat.

I used to try this, but in my parties, which are usually tank heavy, so much
is flying by in the chat window that I'm already at information overload.
Maybe I should turn on some of those filters... Nah, I can't stand to miss
something :-). It wouldn't be the same if I didn't throw in that "Nice
Crit!!" comment here or there.

>
> > Taneran Dreamweaver
> > <Clan Jax>
> > Bard of the 30th song
> > Prexus
> >
> Bien
> <snip>
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
